text:
New users of Tomcat have a slot special directions to read if the pick the RPMS
install. First you have to realize that the webapps RPMS is a separate install.
Then you have to create file "/etc/java.conf".  Then you have to know that the
instructions in RUNNING.TXT are wrong because there is no startup.sh in bin.
Also see related bugs 10328 and 11965.

It really needs to be turnkey so a Linux user can browse to the Tomcat binary
release downlad page and find something that works out of the box without a lot
of manual steps and special knowledge.

Some Tomcat users are giving up when they get here and it doesn't work. The
binary release needs to be turnkey and the installation has to be bug free or
new users will assume that Tomcat is not useable.
creator: tech@jotobjects.com

text:
Let me say that making rpm for projects like tomcat4 are not en easy task and I
do my best to make them TURNKEY.

using rpm -Ivh tomcat4-xxx tomcat4-webapps-xxx tomcat4-admin-webapps-xxx should
be something easy for any newcomer.

For RPM specific area, there is a TOMCAT4.README.RPM located in
/usr/share/doc/tomcat4-4.1.10 which give usefull information about the rpm.

Yes, the general documentation is not updated since RPM packaging is a specific
deployement and I don't want to change this. 

But you're welcome to send updates to TOMCAT4.README.RPM to make the rpm still
more TURNKEY....
creator: hgomez@apache.org
